channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: California governor proposes $7 billion investment in public broadband
item.description: Newsom claims the state will close the digital divide if it's approved.

item.title: Former HTC designer Scott Croyle is reportedly working on Beats at Apple
item.description: Croyle previously oversaw the HTC One M7 and M8, as well as Nextbit Robin.

item.title: Google Home Max is $150 for the first time since Black Friday
item.description: A4C has discounted the smart speaker to $199.95. Using the checkout code “SLICK25,” you can get an additional $49.98 off the Home Max, making it $149.97 before tax and shipping.

item.title: This week's best deals: $100 off Apple's MacBook Air M1 and more
item.description: This week's best tech deals include $100 off Apple's latest MacBook Pro M1 and $100 off the Nanit Pro baby monitoring system.

item.title: Take control of your stress with must-have wearable Apollo Neuro
item.description: The Apollo Neuro uses gentle vibrations to improve your body’s reaction to stress. It helps users sleep, focus and stay calm, with no side effects.

item.title: Nintendo says almost 6 million households bought a second Switch last year
item.description: As if finding a Switch wasn’t already difficult enough during the pandemic.

item.title: What to expect at Google I/O 2021
item.description: We don’t know everything Google has in store for Google I/O 2021, but we have some educated guesses — and a few things we’re hoping against hope to see. Here’s everything we know about the show so far, and what you can expect to learn more about once the event kicks off in earnest.

item.title: Sega considers reviving classics like 'Crazy Taxi' and 'Jet Set Radio'
item.description: Sega is considering reviving multiple classic game franchises, including 'Crazy Taxi' and 'Jet Set Radio.'

item.title: Crypto exchange Binance faces US money laundering probe
item.description: Binance, the world's leading cryptocurrency exchange, is reportedly being probed by the DoJ and IRS amid allegations that it is being used to launder money.

item.title: Eufy's popular budget robovacs reach all-time lows in Amazon's one-day sale
item.description: Anker's Eufy-branded robovacs have dropped to all-time low prices through a one-day Amazon sale, making them easy choices.

item.title: Facebook has trained an AI to treat irrelevant data like spoiled milk
item.description: Facebook researchers hope to help future AIs pay better attention by giving data an expiration date.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Book Pro 360 review: Shoddy software mars great hardware
item.description: The Galaxy Book Pro 360 is an impressively thin and light 15-inch laptop with a vibrant AMOLED screen. But its webcam is utterly horrible.

item.title: Google fronts Big Tech legal fight to preserve visas for immigrant spouses
item.description: Google has submitted an amicus brief signed by almost 30 tech companies urging for the preservation of work rights for the spouses of H1-B visa holders.

item.title: Microsoft expands its Dolby Vision HDR gaming test on Xbox Series X/S
item.description: The feature is available via the Insider Alpha ring for now, but it'll roll out to everyone soon.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Why are Apple and Epic fighting?
item.description: This week, Cherlynn and Devindra chat with Mike Futter, author of the GameDev Business Handbook and co-host of the Virtual Economy podcast, about the ongoing legal battle between Epic Games and Apple.

item.title: Can Sony reclaim its former glory?
item.description: The real question facing Sony now: How can it return to being an innovation leader?

item.title: Google inks cloud deal with SpaceX's Starlink internet service
item.description: SpaceX will install Starlink ground stations within Google's data center properties under a new deal between the two companies.

item.title: The Morning After: Elon Musk's fascination with Dogecoin continues
item.description: Today’s headlines: Elon Musk Dogecoin efficiency tweet pushes prices up again, Framework’s modular DIY laptop is available to pre-order and Nokia relaunches a flip-phone in the US.

item.title: Ireland's health service shuts down IT systems after ransomware attack
item.description: Ireland's Health Service Executive has been hit with a ransomware attack causing it to shut down its IT network and resort to pen and paper records.

item.title: The Pentagon is tracking US citizens without a warrant, Senator says
item.description: The Pentagon may be using commercial data to track Americans without due legal process, according to a letter from Senator Ron Wyden.

item.title: Netflix is making a CG-animated 'Ultraman' feature film
item.description: Netflix is developing an Ultraman CG-animated feature film in partnership with Tsuburaya Productions.

item.title: Fisker, Foxconn deal to build EVs in the US is 'signed and sealed'
item.description: The iPhone manufacturer is teaming up with Fisker to build an electric car.

item.title: ESPN+ will stream La Liga soccer starting next season
item.description: After losing Italy's Serie A to Paramount+, ESPN has announced a deal with Spain's La Liga for next season.

item.title: Elon Musk efficiency tweet pushes Dogecoin prices up again
item.description: Doge prices spiked after Elon Musk tweeted about "potentially promising" work to make the meme cryptocurrency more efficient.

item.title: SpaceX charts a path for Starship's first orbital test flight
item.description: In a filing with the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), the company details how it hopes its latest test flight will unfold.
